intro: Seseli marashica, commonly known as Marash bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Turkey. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and delicate, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in temperate climates. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
